intro: Cyclopogon warmingii, commonly known as the St. John's wort of the Caribbean, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features include a short, woody stem and small, clustered inflorescences. Cyclopogon warmingii is noted for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
